title: Asparagus & Parmigiano Soft Scramble
description: A creamy, silky soft-scrambled egg dish studded with tender asparagus tips and finished with nutty Parmigiano-Reggiano. Quick to make for breakfast, brunch, or a light dinner—bright lemon zest and chives lift the richness.

ingredients.display_name: asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces (tips reserved separately)

steps.text: Prep asparagus by trimming woody ends, cutting stalks into 1-inch pieces and reserving the tips whole; slice chives and grate Parmigiano; bring eggs to room temperature and lightly beat with a fork until just combined; if using milk or cream, add it to the eggs.

Heat a medium nonstick skillet over medium heat, add olive oil and half the butter; when shimmering, add asparagus pieces (not tips) and sauté, stirring, until bright green and just tender-crisp, about 3–4 minutes; season lightly with a pinch of salt. Remove asparagus to a bowl and keep tips separate.
Reduce heat to low–medium; add remaining butter to the same skillet and let it foam gently; add reserved asparagus tips and warm for 30–45 seconds to soften slightly without wilting.

Pour beaten eggs into the pan over low heat; let cook undisturbed for about 10–15 seconds until edges set, then using a silicone spatula, gently pull cooked edges toward center, forming soft curds. Continuously but slowly fold eggs, keeping temperature low to achieve a custardy texture.

When eggs are about 70% set (still glossy and slightly runny), fold in sautéed asparagus pieces, warm tips, grated Parmigiano, most of the chives, lemon zest (if using), and remaining salt and pepper; cook another 30–60 seconds off direct heat if necessary to allow cheese to melt into the eggs.

Remove pan from heat while eggs are still slightly softer than desired (they will finish setting from residual heat); taste and adjust seasoning. Divide scramble between plates and garnish with remaining chives and extra Parmigiano.
